-1x.png.description: graph of the line that passes through (-1,1) and (0,0)

-2x-5.png.description: diagonal line passing through the points (-4,3) and (0,-5)

0.5x+2.png.description: graph of a line passing through the points (-4, 0) (-2, 1) and (0, 2)

10x+7-normalized.png.description: graph of the line that passes through (0,7) and (-1,-3)

23rdsx+4.png.description: graph of a line that passes through (0,4) and (6,0)

2x.png.description: graph of a line passing through the points (0,0) (1,2) (2,4) (3,6) (4,8)

3x.png.description: graph of a line passing through the points (-2,-6) and (0,0)

constant-linear.png.description: horizontal line crossing the y-axis at 48

negative.png.description: graph: diagonal line sloping downward from left to right

negative-linear.png.description: a diagonal line, sloping downward from left to right

nonlin1.png.description: a jagged line plot that moves up and down between 30 and 5 as the x-value increases from 0 to 12

nonlin2.png.description: A jagged graph, similar to the profile of a mountain, working its way down from 32 to 0 as x increases from 0 to 12

not-a-function.png.description: u-shaped graph opening to the right

notice-wonder.png.description: table and graph of a line including the points (0,0) (1,2) (2,4) (3,6) (4,8)

num-abs.png.description: upside-down v-shaped graph with its vertex at the origin

num-sqr.png.description: a u-shaped graph, opening upward, with its vertex at the origin

num-sqrt.png.description: two curves: one rounds down from (-7.5, 2.75) to the origin and the other curves up from the origin to (7.5, 2.75)

positive-linear.png.description: a diagonal line, sloping updward from left to right

positive.png.description: graph: diagonal line sloping upwards from left to right

rot-abs.png.description: v-shaped graph opening to the right with its vertex at the origin

scatterplot.png.description: scatter plot with no apparent pattern

slope.png.description: graph of a diagonal line passing through (0,1) and (5,4) showing how to calculate the slope is 3/5

slope-2-points.png.description: line connecting (0,1) and (5,4) with a slope of 3/5 arrived at by subtracting 4 minus 1 to get 3 and 5 minus 0 to get 5

sqrtx.png.description: curve beginning at (0,0) sloping up and to the right through (4,2)

sqr(x).png.description: u-shape curve passing through the points (-10, 100) (0,0) (10,100)

x+3.png.description: graph of the line that passes through (-1,2) and (0,3)

x.png.description: graph of a diagonal line passing through the points (0,0) adn (2,2)

y-intercept-diagonal.png.description: graph: diagonal line crosses the y-axis at (0,-1.5)

y-intercept-horizontal.png.description: graph: horizontal line crosses the y-axis at (0,1)
